page.title: 06LAW and ORDER IN SHALBOURNE
page.content: Four years ago, the{village policeman {was removed}and the police house sold. We now share a policeman on the beat with Burbage. If we need the police, other than in an emergency, we have to phone Marlborough. Vandalism in the district is mostly of petty nature: breaking off of plants, dropping litter, removing and breaking road and house signs. There is too much{speeding}through the village. There are few pavements and a speed limit is not allowed as there is no street lighting. The roads are very narrow, with several blind corners contributing to accidents. There have been several{burglaries}in the area in the last five years: the nearness to the M4 motorway makes access and get- away easy. Several burglar alarms have been installed and no one now leaves doors or windows unlocked.
